verses.roman:
ko bhavān parayā lakṣmyā
rocate 'dbhuta-darśanaḥ
kathaṁ jugupsitām etāṁ
gatiṁ vā prāpito 'vaśaḥ

synonyms: kaḥ—who; bhavān—your good self; parayā—with great; lakṣmyā—beauty; rocate—shine; adbhuta—wonderful; darśanaḥ—to see; katham—why; yugupsitām—terrible; etām—this; gatim—destination; vā—and; prāpitaḥ—made to assume; avaśaḥ—beyond your control.
translation: [Lord Kṛṣṇa said:] My dear sir, you appear so wonderful, glowing with such great beauty. Who are you? And who forced you to assume this terrible body of a snake?
